description: A collection of circles in a tilted, roughly rectangular formation; there is a small rectangular formation with a rounded top extending upwards from the top left corner of the rectangular formation, a triangular formation to the right of the top right corner, and a thick L-shaped formation underneath the bottom right corner. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a black triangle in the center of the tilted rectangular formation and a dark gray triangle on the right side.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
